name: scottcame_us-house-psci-social-media-ads
title: US House PSCI Social Media Ads
description:
Parsed metadata from the collection of social media ads released by the US House of Representatives in May 2018

In [releasing](https://democrats-intelligence.house.gov/facebook-ads/) over 3500 Facebook ads purchased by the Internet Research Agency, the Minority on the US House of Representatives Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence said:

> As part of that continuing effort to educate the public and seek additional analysis, the Committee Minority is making available all IRA advertisements identified by Facebook. This is an effort to be fully transparent with the public, allow outside experts to analyze the data, and provide the American people a fuller accounting of Russian efforts to sow discord and interfere in our democracy.

This release consisted of a batch of Portable Document File (PDF) files--one file per ad--zipped into 11 zip files and made [available](https://democrats-intelligence.house.gov/facebook-ads/social-media-advertisements.htm) on the PSCI Minority website.

In order to fulfill the Minority's goal of "allow(ing) outside experts to analyze the data", I used [tabula](https://tabula.technology/) via the [tabulizer](https://github.com/ropensci/tabulizer) R package to extract the raw text from each PDF and parse it (in the various formats that tabula produced).  The little R script to do this [lives on GitHub](https://github.com/Data4Democracy/disinfo-campaigns/blob/master/house-psci-facebook-2018/ad-extract-R/ParseAds.R) as part of [Data for Democracy](http://datafordemocracy.org/)'s efforts to research and understand disinformation campaigns.

Comments on the dataset and GitHub issues (or even better PRs) are most welcome!
